trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDeleting"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDeleting> event when a Delete button is clicked or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.DeleteItem%2A> method is called, but before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control deletes the item.

(A Delete button is one whose `CommandName` property is set to "Delete".) This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs, such as canceling the delete operation.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs> object is passed to the event-handling method, which enables you to determine the index of the item that is being deleted.
You can also cancel the delete operation.
To do so, set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs> object to `true`.

If necessary, you can also work with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Values%2A> collections before the values are passed to the data source.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs> class.
This constructor is primarily used by control developers when raising events.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs>.
Property
Initial value
The value of the `itemIndex` parameter.
The index of the item that contains the Delete button that raised the event.
Gets the index of the item being deleted.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.ItemIndex%2A> property to determine the index of the item being deleted.

The item index is typically used to retrieve the specified item from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Items%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control, which enables you to access the item's properties.
The zero-based index of the item being deleted.
Gets a dictionary of field name/value pairs that represent the primary key or keys of the item to delete.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.DataKeyNames%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control is set, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> property to access the value of the primary key or keys in the item to delete.
This property contains only the key fields.
To access the values of the non-key fields, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Values%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> dictionary is automatically populated with the name/value pairs of the field or fields that are specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.DataKeyNames%2A> property.
If the primary key contains multiple fields, a separate entry is added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> dictionary for each key field.

To determine the name of a key field, use the <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry.Key%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of a <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> object that is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> dictionary.
To determine the value of a key field, use the <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
An object that contains the name/value pairs that represent the primary key or keys of the item to delete.
Gets a dictionary of the non-key field name/value pairs in the item to delete.
Use the dictionary in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Values%2A> property to access the values of the non-key fields in the item to delete.
This property does not contain the primary key field or fields.
To access the values of the primary key or keys, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Values%2A> property is automatically populated with the name/value pairs of the non-key fields in the item.
A separate entry is added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Keys%2A> property for each key field in the item.

To determine the field name of an entry, use the <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry.Key%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of a <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> object that is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDeleteEventArgs.Values%2A> dictionary.
To determine the value of an entry, use the <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
An object that contains the non-key field name/value pairs of the item to delete.
